intro: Saussurea cana, commonly known as the Chinese yarrow or white saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces small, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in alpine and arctic environments, often growing at high elevations with poor soil conditions. Saussurea cana is valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
